segment.source: Description: The Acquisitions report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see who has acquired your app, along with demographic and platform details.
segment.target: Description: The Acquisitions report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see who has acquired your app, along with demographic and platform details.

segment.source: title: Acquisitions report
segment.target: title: Acquisitions report

segment.source: ms.assetid: 21126362-F3CD-4006-AD3F-82FC88E3B862
segment.target: ms.assetid: 21126362-F3CD-4006-AD3F-82FC88E3B862

segment.source: Acquisitions report
segment.target: Acquisitions report

segment.source: The Acquisitions report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see who has acquired your app, along with demographic and platform details.
segment.target: The Acquisitions report in the Windows Dev Center dashboard lets you see who has acquired your app, along with demographic and platform details.

segment.source: You can view this data in your dashboard, or download the report to view offline.
segment.target: You can view this data in your dashboard, or download the report to view offline.

segment.source: In this report, an acquisition means a new customer has obtained a license to your app (whether you charged money or you've offered it for free).
segment.target: In this report, an acquisition means a new customer has obtained a license to your app (whether you charged money or you've offered it for free).

segment.source: Important The Acquisitions report does not include data about refunds, reversals, chargebacks, etc. To estimate your app proceeds, visit Payout summary.
segment.target: Important The Acquisitions report does not include data about refunds, reversals, chargebacks, etc. To estimate your app proceeds, visit Payout summary.

segment.source: In the Reserved section, click the Download reserved transactions link.
segment.target: In the Reserved section, click the Download reserved transactions link.

segment.source: Apply filters
segment.target: Apply filters

segment.source: Near the top of the page, you can expand Apply filters to filter all of the data on this page by date range and/or by device type.
segment.target: Near the top of the page, you can expand Apply filters to filter all of the data on this page by date range and/or by device type.

segment.source: Date: The default filter is Last 30 days, but you can expand this up to Last 12 months.
segment.target: Date: The default filter is Last 30 days, but you can expand this up to Last 12 months.

segment.source: Device type: The default setting is All devices.
segment.target: Device type: The default setting is All devices.

segment.source: If you want to show data for acquisitions from a certain device type only, you can choose a specific one here.
segment.target: If you want to show data for acquisitions from a certain device type only, you can choose a specific one here.

segment.source: The info in the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the Apply filters section.
segment.target: The info in the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the Apply filters section.

segment.source: The info in all of the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the Apply filters section.
segment.target: The info in all of the charts listed below will reflect the period of time selected in the Apply filters section.

segment.source: By default this will include data for all device types, unless you've used Apply filters to choose only one.
segment.target: By default this will include data for all device types, unless you've used Apply filters to choose only one.

segment.source: Acquisitions
segment.target: Acquisitions

segment.source: The Acquisitions chart shows the number of daily or weekly acquisitions of your app over the selected period of time.
segment.target: The Acquisitions chart shows the number of daily or weekly acquisitions of your app over the selected period of time.

segment.source: (When you use Apply filters to filter the data over a longer duration, the data will be grouped by week.)
segment.target: (When you use Apply filters to filter the data over a longer duration, the data will be grouped by week.)

segment.source: You can also see the lifetime number of acquisitions for your app.
segment.target: You can also see the lifetime number of acquisitions for your app.

segment.source: This shows the cumulative total of all acquisitions, starting from when your app was first published.
segment.target: This shows the cumulative total of all acquisitions, starting from when your app was first published.

segment.source: You can optionally filter the results by market and/or by OS version.
segment.target: You can optionally filter the results by market and/or by OS version.

segment.source: Customer demographic
segment.target: Customer demographic

segment.source: The Customer demographic chart shows demographic info about the people who acquired your app.
segment.target: The Customer demographic chart shows demographic info about the people who acquired your app.

segment.source: You can see how many acquisitions (over the selected period of time) were made by people in a certain age group and by which gender.
segment.target: You can see how many acquisitions (over the selected period of time) were made by people in a certain age group and by which gender.

segment.source: Note Some customers have opted not to share this info.
segment.target: Note Some customers have opted not to share this info.

segment.source: If we were unable to determine the age group or gender, the acquisition is categorized as Unknown.
segment.target: If we were unable to determine the age group or gender, the acquisition is categorized as Unknown.

segment.source: Markets
segment.target: Markets

segment.source: The Markets chart shows the total number of acquisitions over the selected period of time by market.
segment.target: The Markets chart shows the total number of acquisitions over the selected period of time by market.

segment.source: By default, we show you the market which had the most acquisitions on top and continue downward from there.
segment.target: By default, we show you the market which had the most acquisitions on top and continue downward from there.

segment.source: You can reverse this order by toggling the arrow in the Acquisitions column of this chart.
segment.target: You can reverse this order by toggling the arrow in the Acquisitions column of this chart.

segment.source: OS version
segment.target: OS version

segment.source: The OS version chart shows the total number of acquisitions based on the customer's operating system (or via volume acquisition by organizations).
segment.target: The OS version chart shows the total number of acquisitions based on the customer's operating system (or via volume acquisition by organizations).

segment.source: In some cases we may not be able to determine this info.
segment.target: In some cases we may not be able to determine this info.

segment.source: In that case, the OS version will be listed as Unknown.
segment.target: In that case, the OS version will be listed as Unknown.
